titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Karen Swenson Papers MSS.069
titlestmt.author: Jennifer E. Neal

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-07-19 13:49:42 -0400.

change.item: Edited by Weatherly Stephan to reflect addition of printed material in Series VI

physdesc.extent: in 14 manuscript boxes, 5 record cartons, and 1 card box

did.abstract: Karen Swenson (born 1936) is an American poet, educator, and journalist. Born in New York City, Swenson attended Barnard College and New York University. She taught for fifteen years at City University in New York and is a celebrated published author and world traveler. The collection dates between 1945 and 2002, with the bulk dating between 1974 and 1994. Materials include literary journals and print publications, newspaper and magazine articles; correspondence; poems; photocopied manuscripts; photographs; and four audiocassettes.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

accessrestrict.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedure
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596, with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Karen Swenson in 1996; accretion donated in 2005. Accession numbers related to the donations are 1996.069 and 2005.069.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in the following series, with each series arranged at the folder level, in alphabetical order by topic:

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Karen Swenson (born 1936) is an American poet, educator, and journalist. Swenson was born in New York City and grew up in Chappaqua, New York. She attended Barnard College and New York University, and was a poet in residence at Skidmore College, University of Idaho, Denver University, Clark University, Scripps College, and Barnard College. She taught for fifteen years at City University in New York and is a celebrated published author and world traveler. Swenson wrote of her travels for The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The New Leader, and several magazines.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Karen Swenson Papers; MSS 069; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection maintains intellectual order with like materials housed together. The bulk of the collection was rehoused in archival folders and rearranged by series in the existing boxes. Existing folder labels were maintained and the folders were renumbered. Metal and plastic clips were removed. Audiocassettes were rehoused in cassette cases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials created by Karen Swenson that document her personal and professional interests throughout her career as an American poet, educator, and journalist. Materials include printed publications, correspondence, clippings, ephemera, poetry, and photographs. The printed publications from Swenson's personal library include inscribed literary journals and books that she collected between 1973 and 2002. The correspondence files include professional and personal letters, postcards, and greeting cards written to and from Swenson between 1963 and 1985, some featuring her poems. Many letters to Swenson include analysis of specific poems she sent to friends and colleagues. The bulk of the collection includes Swenson's typed and handwritten poems, and photocopied manuscripts of published poems between 1945 and 2002. Most of the poems are undated and include Swenson's handwritten annotations.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Printed publications selected for deacession will be reviewed by the curator and added to the Library collection or the Library's duplicates collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection created by Karen Swenson was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes photocopied magazine articles, and original and photocopied newspaper articles.

did.unittitle: Printed Material. Book Reviews of An Attic of Ideals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes typed and handwritten letters, postcards, greeting cards, original envelopes, and attachments, including photographs. The bulk of the correspondence was received by Karen Swenson but there are a few folders of letters written by Swenson. Folders in boxes 1, 2, and 3 note correspondence with Bruce Berger, Michael Blumenthal , Charles Altieri, [?] Bell, Carol Berge, Robert Boyers, Christopher Brookhouse, Helen Brown, Michael Browne, Jean Burden, John Ciardi, Tony Connor, Mary Crow, George Cuomo, Ki Davis, Richard Eberhart, Kathleen Fraser, Dana Gioia, Jorie Graham, W. S. Graham, Hilda Gregory, Rachel Hadas, Leo Hamalian, Marie Harris, Samuel Hazo, George Hitchcock, Richard Hugo, Lucille Iverson, June Jordan, Donald Justice, George Keithley, X. J. Kennedy, Ismith Kahan, Gallaway Kinnel, Carolyn Kizer, Linda Krenis, Maxine Kumin, Greg Kuzma, Karen Lindsay, Ernest Lookridge, Albert B. Lowenfels, Robert Lowell, Naomi Lazard, Denis Leverton, A. L. Levine, Larry Lieberman, Lyn Lifshin, Pat Madden, Harold Q. Masur, Bill Matthews, Heather McHugh, David Milofsky, Jack Myers, Josephine Nilo, Edward Pennant, Robert Poek, Nilda Raz, M. L. Rosenthal, Stephen Sandy, Reg Saner, Grace Schulman, Peter Sears, Jane Shore, Harry Smith, Kathleen Spirack, Ann Stanford, Ruth Stone, [Mother] Swenson, Helen Susskind, Rawdon Tomlinson, John Updike, John Williams, Martha Winston, Carolyn Wright, Jane Yolen, Al Young, William Zaranke, Betty Kray, Pat Madden, Frank Walker, Elizabeth West, and New York Magazine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes poetry reading fliers, a list of fellowship awards, newsletters, and collected poems.

did.unittitle: Printed Material. Poems by Other People

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the collection, this series includes typed and handwritten poems, and photocopied manuscripts of Swenson's published works. Most of the poems are undated and include Swenson's annotations. This series includes four audiocassettes. Cassette labels indicate three audio recordings of poetry readings and one sample poetry reading.

did.unittitle: Misc. Untitled Poems: Themes of Familial Relations
Misc. Untitled Poems: Subjects of Men and Individual Men
Misc. Untitled Poems: On Nature and the Natural
Misc. Untitled Poems: Themes of Objects and Places
Misc. Untitled Poems: Subject of Poetry
Misc. Unidentified Poems: Subjects of Women and Individual Women
Early Versions of Asian Poems and Non-Asian Poems
Leftovers and Coldcuts, written and narrated by Lambert Glenn Mendershausen [audiocassette]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes one photograph of Karen Swenson in a classroom with children and thirteen photographs of people at a gathering in 1982. Swenson is in three of the photographs.

physdesc.extent: in 2 manuscript boxes and 5 record cartons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes a selection of inscribed publications from Swenson's personal library.
